result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:30  AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael Allan Duvick in court, in custody w/Attorney Philip A. Helgeson. Atty Molly Woodford, representing on a civil matter, observing via zoom. S/T Sgt Robert Unruh, WI State Patrol; direct by Atty Ellenwood. Record reflects identity of DE. Cross by Atty Helgeson. Atty Ellenwood asks court to take judicial notice, with no objections, of the bond in 21CF374, court takes notice. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Ellenwood states Information will mirror the complaint. Atty Helgeson would like to proceed to ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Court extends deadline to file substitution of judge by 10 days due to instant arraignment. Adjourned:  8:42 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
